meanings.definition: In a manner related to motion or movement.
meanings.sent1: The car moved kinematically along the road.
meanings.sent2: She observed the bird flying kinematically through the sky.
meanings.sent3: The robot danced kinematically to the music, amusing the audience.
meanings.sent4: The leaves swirled kinematically in the wind, creating a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The ball rolled kinematically down the hill, leaving a clear path behind.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study of motion without considering the forces causing it.
meanings.sent1: The kinematically calculated speed of the object was precise.
meanings.sent2: The kinematically determined trajectory of the rocket was flawless.
meanings.sent3: The kinematically designed roller coaster provided a thrilling ride for all.
meanings.sent4: Her kinematically perfect form in gymnastics earned her a gold medal.
meanings.sent5: The kinematically smooth motion of the pendulum was mesmerizing to watch.
